intro: Saurauia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Actinidiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems, often growing as an epiphyte on trees. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a smooth surface and can vary in color depending on light exposure. Saurauia pauciflora plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
